text.p: Following are the main stories in Thursday's Malaysian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
All dailies lead with Malaysian Cabinet decision to freeze all fresh bilateral dealings with Singapore following Singapore Senior Minister Lee Kuan Yew's derogatory remarks about a Malaysia state.

-- The two Royal Malaysian Air Force helicopters which crashed in Sabah state last week, killing 11 crew members, were likely to have slammed into a hill, according to a preliminary investigation report.
-- Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad calls for a re-evaluation and reconstruction of Malaysian-Japanese relations in the light of the rapidly changing world economy and technology development.
-- United Malays National Organisation's youth wing chief Ahmad Zahid Hamidi says Singapore should treat the freeze on bilateral dealings with them as a last warning never to look down upon Malaysia.
-- Tourist arrivals in Malaysia between January and August 1996 declined 6.5 percent, Tourism Minister Sabbaruddin Chik says.
